private_information: I know the first scenario initial state: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_9, next object_0 object_7, next object_10 object_5, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8
I have a proposed plan for scenario A consisting of three actions: clip object_9 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_7 object_2; tightfisted object_9 object_4 object_7
actor_a.goal: Provide a structured analysis of action applicability and the causal effects relevant to scenario A without emitting PDDL.

private_information: I know the second scenario initial state variants and desired goal variants: scenario B initial facts include cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_10 object_5, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_5, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8
I can analyze how actions map to the second scenario goals (next object_10 object_6 and next object_9 object_6)
actor_b.goal: Provide a structured analysis of action applicability and the causal effects relevant to scenario B without emitting PDDL.

private_information: I am responsible for auditing temporal and causal consistency across analyses and removing bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties
I will identify implicit assumptions, unify naming mismatches, and flag cycles or impossible preconditions
auditor.goal: Produce a concise audit report that enforces temporal and causal consistency and produces a minimal set of corrected facts and constraints for planner construction.

private_information: I will integrate analyses and the audit report and produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver
Keep agent actions distinct and preserve causal ordering found by auditors
orchestrator.goal: Emit a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem (FastDownwards-compatible) that models the provided actions, initial state(s), and goals while respecting the auditor corrections.

public_information: Objects in the universe are named object_0 through object_10 and collect relationships may reference object indices outside the core action arguments
Available actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted
Each action has explicit preconditions and add/delete effects involving predicates hand, cats, sneeze, texture, vase, next, collect, spring, stupendous

Example pre/post constraints summarized: paltry requires hand,cats,texture,vase,next and sets next and deletes vase; sip, clip, tightfisted similarly toggle vase and next relations; wretched and memory manipulate next relations and rely on collect/sneeze/spring/stupendous predicates
Two scenario initial statements and goal variants are present and should be modeled; agents may have partial overlapping views of initial facts

analysis.system_prompt: You are a domain analyst. Produce a clear structured description of action applicability, the specific preconditions and effects you can verify from your private information, and any ambiguities you observe; do not output PDDL or assume facts you do not have.
analysis.prompt: Your name is actor_a. Use the public information and your private information to list which actions from the domain are applicable in scenario A, enumerate their concrete preconditions and effects as you understand them, and highlight any missing facts or naming mismatches.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a domain analyst. Produce a clear structured description of action applicability, the specific preconditions and effects you can verify from your private information, and any ambiguities you observe; do not output PDDL or assume facts you do not have.
analysis.prompt: Your name is actor_b. Use the public information and your private information to list which actions from the domain are applicable in scenario B, enumerate their concrete preconditions and effects as you understand them, and highlight any missing facts or naming mismatches.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor of temporal and causal consistency. Inspect the analyses, detect and remove bookkeeping shortcuts (tokens, ad-hoc penalties, or post-hoc assumptions), unify naming mismatches, and produce a minimal corrected set of constraints and required ordering relations.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. Receive the analyses from the domain analysts and produce a concise audit report that (1) lists inconsistencies or cycles, (2) unifies any differing names for the same entities, (3) removes informal bookkeeping shortcuts, and (4) emits a recommended set of precondition/effect corrections and ordering constraints for the orchestrator to consume.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL and must produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver. Keep agent actions distinct and retain auditor corrections. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. Integrate the public information, the two analysts' structured analyses, and the auditor report to construct a FastDownwards-compatible PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that capture the action schemas (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted), the corrected initial facts for the scenario(s), and the explicit goal conditions. Keep all agents' actions distinct and explicitly model any ordering constraints recommended by the auditor. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
